sections.title: Objectives
content: Software Engineer with a strong passion for building reliable and impactful systems. After a career in telecom, I transitioned into software development because I enjoy problem-solving and creating solutions that drive value.

My experience includes working with technologies like Python, Django, Docker, and PostgreSQL, as well as contributing to the development and maintenance of a SaaS platform. As the DevOps Engineer for the SaaS startup, I managed deployment pipelines, optimized workflows, and ensured smooth operations across development and production environments.

I‚Äôm eager to continue growing my skills, taking on meaningful projects, and collaborating with teams to create effective and scalable solutions. I‚Äôm seeking opportunities such as a Software Engineer, Backend Developer, Python Developer, DevOps Engineer, or Full Stack Engineer, where I can contribute to impactful work while continuing to expand my expertise in the field.

content.title: Software Engineer/DevOps Engineer
content.text: Developed a greenfield SaaS platform that streamlined RV dealership workflows, reduced financing turnaround times, and improved user efficiency. Scaled the engineering team and implemented Agile practices to ensure consistent delivery.

content.title: Senior Manager
content.text: Led a team of 34 engineers supporting 21 telecommunications platforms, optimizing equipment management and reducing outages by 80% with innovative software solutions.

content.title: Senior Manager
content.text: Directed teams supporting telecom hardware and software, improving system reliability through advanced troubleshooting and documentation. Introduced Lean methodologies to enhance operational efficiency and reduce waste.

sections.title: Pre-Pair SaaS Platform - Live Production System
sections.short_description: Developed and maintained a live SaaS platform using Python, Django, PostgreSQL, and Tailwind CSS, deployed on DigitalOcean. Implemented a CI/CD pipeline with GitHub to automate testing and deployment for a seamless production workflow.
description: At Pre-Pair, I was part of a team that developed a SaaS platform from the ground up, designed to support complex workflows. The project provided a great opportunity to work with a modern tech stack and refine my skills in building scalable, cloud-based applications.

The backend was built using Python and Django, with PostgreSQL as the primary database. For the frontend, we utilized Tailwind CSS, ensuring the user interface was both efficient and easy to maintain. The platform was deployed to DigitalOcean, leveraging its capabilities to provide scalable hosting and reliable uptime.

Our development workflow centered around GitHub, where we managed version control and collaboration. I helped implement a CI/CD pipeline that automated key steps in the development process. Changes pushed to GitHub would trigger automated tests and, if successful, deploy updates to the cloud. This setup minimized manual intervention, improved deployment reliability, and ensured that only thoroughly tested code made it into production.

This experience allowed me to grow in understanding the end-to-end development lifecycle, from local development to deployment in the cloud. It also deepened my familiarity with creating and maintaining CI/CD pipelines, database integration, and ensuring a seamless development workflow.

sections.title: Developer's Portfolio
sections.short_description: A responsive and dynamic portfolio showcasing my development projects, skills, and experience. Built with React, hosted on AWS, and integrated with Cloudflare for seamless performance and reliability.
description: The Developer's Portfolio is a personal website created to highlight my journey as a software developer. Built with React, the portfolio reflects my growing expertise in web development, with a focus on clean design and responsive functionality. Hosted on AWS and integrated with Cloudflare, it demonstrates my ability to deploy and manage modern web applications using industry-standard tools.

The portfolio is designed to be both visually appealing and functional, featuring dynamic content management through a centralized JSON structure. This approach allows for easy updates to projects, skills, and other sections without the need for extensive code changes. Each project is showcased with detailed descriptions, links, and visuals, offering visitors an engaging way to explore my work.

With static hosting on AWS S3 and Cloudflare providing CDN and DNS services, the portfolio delivers fast and reliable performance. Subtle animations, hover effects, and thoughtful design choices enhance the user experience, making the site inviting and intuitive to navigate. This project represents my dedication to continuous learning and serves as a platform to share my skills, experiences, and aspirations with others in the industry.

sections.title: coinID
sections.short_description: A machine learning application for classifying coin images, leveraging PyTorch and robust data augmentation techniques for training and evaluation.
description: The Coin Classification Application is a Python-based machine learning project designed to classify images of coins into categories such as pennies, nickels, dimes, and quarters. Using PyTorch and TorchVision, the project implements a ResNet-18 model to achieve accurate classification, incorporating robust data augmentation techniques to improve model generalization.

The application provides a console-based interface for training, validation, and inference workflows. Users can train the model on custom datasets, evaluate performance using metrics such as accuracy, precision, recall, and F1 score, and visualize results through bar charts, box plots, and scatter plots. Early stopping is integrated to optimize training efficiency.

The project demonstrates practical machine learning capabilities, emphasizing clean design and modularity. With its comprehensive feature set, the application serves as an excellent tool for exploring and understanding machine learning workflows in a practical context.

sections.title: Memory Game
sections.short_description: A retro-style tile-matching game built with pure HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, featuring dynamic tile flips, scoring, and celebratory confetti effects.
description: Retro Flip is a browser-based puzzle game where players flip tiles to match pairs of colors. Styled with a retro aesthetic, the game offers engaging gameplay through dynamic tile animations and a scoring system that tracks both current and high scores. Upon winning, players are rewarded with a vibrant confetti animation as a celebration.

The game is built entirely using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Tiles are shuffled and dynamically generated, with transitions and animations handled through CSS keyframes and JavaScript event listeners. Local storage is used to persist the high score across sessions, making the game both interactive and rewarding.

Retro Flip serves as a great example of how classic game mechanics can be brought to life using modern web technologies, offering a fun and nostalgic experience. It is lightweight, responsive, and works directly in the browser without requiring additional dependencies or installations.
